newsitem.title: USA: Wiz Technology posts Q3 loss, restates Q2.
newsitem.headline: Wiz Technology posts Q3 loss, restates Q2.

text.p: Wiz Technology Inc on Monday reported a third quarter loss of $420,231, or $0.05 per share, in its interim financial statements for the period ended April 30, 1997 resulting in a year to date loss of $2.4 million, or $0.27 per share.
The company also restated its results for the second quarter ended January 31, 1997.

The restated results relate primarily to the accounting treatment of the sale of two intranet contracts for $2 million. After a review, management determined that recognition of the $450,000 in revenues and recording the $2 million contract as an asset was not consistent with generally accepted accounting principles.

The amended report also included previously unrecorded liabilities of $195,000, increase the allowance for doubtful accounts by $200,000 and re-allocate sales commissions of $112,115 from cost of revenues to selling, general and administrative expenses.

The adjustments increased the loss previously reported by $845,000 to $2,018,350 for the six months ended January 31, 1997, or $0.22 loss per share, and a loss for the three months ended January 31, 1997 of $1,769,687 or a $0.20 per share loss.
